## Decile returns

- At beginning of each time period, sort stocks into deciles based on a predictor.
- Time periods could be days, weeks, months, ...
- Days would be realistic.  Months is easier.
- Each decile is a portfolio. Compute return for the period.  
- Repeat next period.





## Data

- Monthly data in SQL database
- 100+ predictors described in ghz-predictors.xlsx
- Today, sort on individual predictors
- Next topic: combine predictors via machine learning

## SQL 

- select [columns] from [table] 
- join [another table] on [variables to match on]
- where [select rows based on conditions]
- order by [columns to sort on]

## Sort into deciles each month

```p
data["decile"] = data.groupby("date").roeq.transform(
  lambda x: pd.qcut(x, 10, labels=range(1, 11))
)
data.head()
```

. . .

```{python}
data["decile"] = data.groupby("date").roeq.transform(
  lambda x: pd.qcut(x, 10, labels=range(1, 11))
)
data.head()
```

## Compute portfolio returns each month

. . .

```p
rets = data.groupby(['date', 'decile']).ret.mean()
rets = rets.unstack()
rets.head()
```

. . .

```{python}
rets = data.groupby(['date', 'decile']).ret.mean()
rets = rets.unstack()
rets.head()
```

## Average returns across months


## Compound returns across months

. . .



## Factor investing

- Factors are stock characteristics for which stocks that share the characteristic
  - tend to move together
  -  have had higher average returns than other stocks
- High ROE is an ingredient in quality factors.
- [Factor investing at BlackRock](https://www.blackrock.com/us/individual/investment-ideas/what-is-factor-investing){.external target="_blank"}
